p: Regarding steroidal “pseudo-alkaloids,” they are often glycosylated (glycoalkaloids). These peculiar compounds are produced in more than 350 plant species, mainly from Solanaceae and Liliaceae families [ 160]. They consist of a C 27 cholestane skeleton (aglycone), where the –OH in position -3 is glycosylated by one to five monosaccharides, such as D-glucose, D-galactose, D-xylose and L-rhamnose.
